designScenario.name: Landing Gear Retraction System
designScenario.description: Design a fail-safe retraction mechanism integrated with the aircraft's Landing Gear System, ensuring rapid and reliable gear stowage post-takeoff. The system must synchronize hydraulic actuation, mechanical locking, and sensor feedback while maintaining aerodynamic efficiency, structural integrity, and redundancy under varying operational conditions.

details.description: The system must retract all landing gear assemblies simultaneously with precise synchronization to prevent asymmetric aerodynamic loads.
Mechanical locks must engage automatically upon full retraction to secure gear in the stowed position.
Full retraction cycle must complete within 3 seconds at -40°C to +60°C operational temperature range.
Hydraulic actuators must generate ≥15,000 lbf linear force to overcome aerodynamic resistance during retraction.
Backup mechanical release mechanism must deploy if primary hydraulic retraction fails.
Dual-channel position sensors must cross-validate gear stowage status before cockpit indication.
Retraction actuators must allow seal replacement without full system depressurization.
All components must meet DO-160G standards for environmental resistance.

relationships.description: Requires continuous hydraulic pressure supply from main aircraft hydraulic system during retraction cycle
Mechanically integrated with main gear strut for positive latching
Receives real-time position data from gear proximity sensors for closed-loop control
Door actuation sequence is time-synchronized with gear retraction movement
Lock engagement status monitored by redundant safety sensors
